EML

write_eml

write_eml

write_eml(eml, file = NULL, namespaces = NULL, ns = "eml", ...)

Arguments

eml
an eml class object
file
file name to write XML. If NULL, will return XML as character string.
namespaces
named character vector of additional XML namespaces to use.
ns
root namespace abbreviation
...
additional arguments to saveXML

Value

If file is not specified, the result is a character string containing the resulting XML content. Otherwise return silently.

Examples

f <- system.file("xsd/test", "eml.xml", package = "EML")
eml <- read_eml(f)
write_eml(eml)
#> [1] "<eml:eml xmlns:eml=\"eml://ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.1.1\" xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\" xmlns:xsi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance\" xmlns:stmml=\"http://www.xml-cml.org/schema/stmml_1.1\" packageId=\"eml.1.1\" system=\"knb\" xsi:schemaLocation=\"eml://ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.1.1 eml.xsd\">\n  <dataset>\n    <title>Sample dataset Description</title>\n    <creator id=\"23445\" scope=\"document\">\n      <individualName>\n        <surName>Smith</surName>\n      </individualName>\n    </creator>\n    <creator id=\"23446\" scope=\"document\">\n      <individualName>\n        <surName>Smith</surName>\n      </individualName>\n    </creator>\n    <additionalInfo>\n      <para>My comments go here.</para>\n    </additionalInfo>\n    <intellectualRights>\n      <section>\n        <para>Anyone can use it.</para>\n      </section>\n    </intellectualRights>\n    <distribution>\n      <online>\n        <connectionDefinition scope=\"document\">\n          <schemeName system=\"CAP\">sde</schemeName>\n          <description>\n            <para>The SDE scheme used at CAP LTER</para>\n          </description>\n          <parameterDefinition>\n            <name>hostname</name>\n            <definition>The host</definition>\n            <defaultValue>mohave.asu.edu</defaultValue>\n          </parameterDefinition>\n          <parameterDefinition>\n            <name>databaseName</name>\n            <definition>The name of the database or catalog</definition>\n          </parameterDefinition>\n          <parameterDefinition>\n            <name>owner</name>\n            <definition>The owner catalog</definition>\n            <defaultValue>dbo</defaultValue>\n          </parameterDefinition>\n        </connectionDefinition>\n      </online>\n    </distribution>\n    <purpose>\n      <para>Provide data to the whole world.</para>\n    </purpose>\n    <contact>\n      <individualName>\n        <surName>Johnson</surName>\n      </individualName>\n    </contact>\n    <contact>\n      <references>23445</references>\n    </contact>\n  </dataset>\n</eml:eml>"
